description.narrative:
1. Number of start-ups supported % of women employed % of young people (aged up to 29) employed % of Roma employed % of start-ups established by people with disabilities
2. Number of participants who completed the training on business plans development
3. Number of additional jobs created in successful small companies % of young staff (aged up to 29) employed % women employed % of supported initiatives that will enable the development of innovative solutions
4. Number of active Youth Info Clubs;
5. Number of downloads of PRV.mk mobile application and number of PRV.MK website visitors
6. Number of individuals at risk of social exclusion who received support through the Community Works Programme % of young people (aged up to 29) who received support through the Community Works Programme % of increase in the number of end beneficiaries (recipients of social services) of the Community Works Programme
7. Number of participants who attended the training on providing professional services to the elderly and obtained a certificate/ license, as part of the Community Works Programme
8. Number of companies supported with a concrete plan for enhanced marketing and presentation of products and services
9. Number of tools developed and provided for local partners to improve monitoring and real time reporting on Employment Programmes' results
10. Number of sector-specific and/or local/regional skills needs assessment studies conducted and curriculum design supported in sectors with high employment opportunities for the disadvantaged;
11. A model and procedures for training provision to people facing social exclusion developed

comment.narrative:
1. The SME sector is facing difficulties in terms of growth and new jobs generation. Since 2007, the Employment Generation Programme helped create over 6,700 new start-ups. 36% of the newly created start-ups are being run by women and 28.4% by young people Self-employment measure targeting people with disabilities has been implemented for the first time in the country by UNDP
2. Since 2007. over 8,300 people have acquired entrepreneurship skills by attending trainings organized by UNDP supported projects
3. Micro and small enterprises (MSEs) limited in their ability to grow and thus hire more workers. In 2014, 82 micro and small companies received help to expand their business, creating additional 119 jobs. Since 2007, 306 MSEs have been supported and 446 new long-term jobs have been created.
4. The activity rate among young people aged 15-24 is extremely low, i.e. 30.6%, which is almost one third of that of persons aged 25-49 (80.1% in Q42014). 4 Youth Info Clubs at four technical faculties have been opened in the country in 2014.
5. 1,530 active users of PRV.mk; 6,500 application downloads; over 1,5 million web site visitors
6. In the period from 2012 to 2014, 220 unemployed people got 6 months short-term employment. In average, 70% of them are women and app. 40% are youth (aged up to 29 years);
7. N/A
8. Lack of supporting activities in the area of marketing and promotion to help the growth of micro and small companies
9. National partners need to enhance their capacity for providing e-services to registered unemployed persons
10. National partners need to improve their capacities for more active cooperation with the private sector and its direct involvement in local level labour market analyses
11. The Adult Education Centre is still not fully operational; institutions' responsibilities are not yet clearly defined, there is lack of coordination between different institutions; There are no procedures for the implementation of educational activiti
120 self-employments/small businesses established by persons with disability and additional jobs created

117 self-employments/small businesses established by persons with disability and 24 additional jobs created. - 32 (27%) women entrepreneurs established businesses. - 85 (73%) men entrepreneurs established businesses, and - 20 (18%) young up to 29 y.

comment.narrative:
1. The SME sector is facing difficulties in terms of growth and new jobs generation. Since 2007, the Employment Generation Programme helped create over 6,700 new start-ups. 36% of the newly created start-ups are being run by women and 28.4% by young people Self-employment measure targeting people with disabilities has been implemented for the first time in the country by UNDP
2. Since 2007. over 8,300 people have acquired entrepreneurship skills by attending trainings organized by UNDP supported projects
3. Micro and small enterprises (MSEs) limited in their ability to grow and thus hire more workers. In 2014, 82 micro and small companies received help to expand their business, creating additional 119 jobs. Since 2007, 306 MSEs have been supported and 446 new long-term jobs have been created.
4. The activity rate among young people aged 15-24 is extremely low, i.e. 30.6%, which is almost one third of that of persons aged 25-49 (80.1% in Q42014). 4 Youth Info Clubs at four technical faculties have been opened in the country in 2014.

6. In the period from 2012 to 2014, 220 unemployed people got 6 months short-term employment. In average, 70% of them are women and app. 40% are youth (aged up to 29 years);

11. The Adult Education Centre is still not fully operational; institutions' responsibilities are not yet clearly defined, there is lack of coordination between different institutions; There are no procedures for the implementation of educational activiti

title.narrative: Response to Flash Floods in Skopje and Tetovo

description.narrative: Devastating flash floods hit Skopje on the night of 6-7 August 2016. Heavy rains also flooded low-lying urban areas in Skopje and caused damage in parts of Tetovo that had been hit in floods in 2015.

title.narrative: Response to Flash Floods in Skopje and Tetovo

description.narrative: The Post-Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) that UNDP is undertaking together with the EU and the World Bank to assess the impact of the flash floods in Skopje is expected to identify further urgent priorities for flood preventing.
